title: Auth Connect
body: Ionic Auth Connect handles logging in and/or registering a user with an authentication provider (such as Auth0, Azure AD, or AWS Cognito) using industry standard OAuth/OpenId Connect on iOS, Android, or on the web.
, it provides a complete security solution for authentication and storage of logged-in credentials.
Auth Connect also allows your app to support multiple authentication providers. Should you need to change providers, easily switch between them without having to develop a new solution.
Update the native project config files:
using Auth0. Simply swap the Auth0 configuration in the
object to switch to a different auth provider.
The hosting app configures Auth Connect with settings specific to each authentication provider. This is done by passing in an instance of
class is the main interface exposed by the Auth Connect plugin, and is expected to be subclassed for specific behaviors and/or events.
The default behavior for caching tokens in the plugin is not secure and should be replaced with something more robust, such as integrating it with the
To access callbacks, and override behavior as needed, it is recommended to subclass the
Leveraging the OAuth/OpenId Connect protocols, Auth Connect supports:
The typical Auth Connect workflow consists of:
The hosting app instantiates the Auth Connect Plugin, passing in the
object. Configure it based on the chosen
On app load, the hosting app calls
to check if the user is logged in already.
If the user isn't logged in, redirect the app to a Login page and call the
method. Auth Connect loads the chosen auth provider's login page.
The app user enters their username and password and taps the provider's login button.
On success, Auth Connect automatically retrieves and stores the user's access token. The
method is fired, and the app can redirect to the desired protected homepage.
method can be called at any point to refresh the access token.
to retrieve the access token if making any API requests to the auth provider.

You will then need to change external references from
(the name is not important so much as the fact that you are not overriding the base class method, pick a name that makes sense to you). You will also need to use the
required if you need to support pre-Chromium Edge browsers. If you are creating a pure hybrid-native app or otherwise have no reason to support pre-Chromium Edge, then you can override methods like
Login can occur either within the current tab/window or a separate pop-up window (the default). Here's a visual comparison:
The current tab option is great for developers supporting IE11. Within the

You can find the API and interface documentation for everything below. The main classes to pay attention to are:
any additional parameters that should be added to the login request examples: `login_hint`, `domain_hint`
expire the current access token, but keep the refresh token, useful for testing
get the access token, once logged in, for API calls
Optional token name, only used when multiple tokens are required (Azure specific feature).
The scopes for the access token.
get the full original auth response
get the parsed id token, includes requested scope values
get the refresh token if available

check to see if the access token is available
Optional token name, only used when multiple tokens are required (Azure specific feature).
check to see if the access token is expired
check to see if the user is logged in, and refresh the token if needed
check to see if the refresh token is available
Using configuration display the auth provider's login UI.
The overrideUrl parameter should only be used when the default discovery url needs to be overrode. (The known use case is with Azure AD custom user flows/policies.)
Event handler which can be overridden to handle successful login events
Event handler which can be overridden to handle successful logout events
refresh the session, throws if refresh token is invalid or missing
Optional token name, only used when multiple tokens are required (Azure specific feature).

avoids the prompt but the session will only be shared with Safari on iOS 10 or lower.

AndroidX is now required in projects with auth v2.
Fix an issue where Auth Connect didn't work on Android 10.
await the access token from storage
Fix a bug where if a provider doesn't return when the access token expires it defaults to be immediately expired.
Fix an issue where if refresh failed isAuthenticated still returned true
move AuthenticationServices import from .m to .h for Capacitor compat
catch error on refresh frame creation
fix for SE-150. Added logout_uri to list of valid params.
await the access token from storage
Fix an issue where Auth Connect didn't work on Android 10.
Fix an issue where if refresh failed isAuthenticated still returned true
Fix a bug where if a provider doesn't return when the access token expires it defaults to be immediately expired.
catch error on refresh frame creation
fix for SE-150. Added logout_uri to list of valid params.
throw error if POST to token endpoint failed
properly refresh token when using PKCE
reject if user closed the auth browser
SE-132: allow client_secret to be passed into authorization calls.
update to general to send client secret in payload of token call
prevent blank screen on SFSafariViewController presentation
implement IonicSecureWebView.hide() to avoid invalid action
add in new interface for ios 13 when using ASWebAuthenticationPresentationContextProviding
rename AFNetworking symbols that conflic with advanced-http plugin
make sure interfaces are not snake cased, move some parameters off to method to make them more dynmaic, clean up some parameter checking to be more clear, make some dictionary combines clearer.
changes for supporting implicit path (aka web) in window rather than in tabs. allow pass through of login_hint value for azure/auth0 and domain_hint for azure. fixes for param handling
make sure the access token is valid before returning it
password reset error was being ignored and needed to check  (hash) not  (query params) for value
Fix issue with IE 11 not working.

support acquiring multiple tokens from an oauth source (especially azure ad), also fix some issues with refresh for the web path. The major change is that getToken now has two optional paramters, they both must be passed in or neither. The parameters are an id for the token being acquired and the specific scope for the token being acquired.
Remove extra plugin dependencies and unify flow across Android and all iOS webviews.
